data.title: 30 Best New Teen Movies of 2023
data.meta_description: Get ready to go to the movies a lot in 2023! Here are the best new teen movies we're excited about the most, from "Challengers" to the "Hunger Games" prequel.
data.text:
When it premieres: January 20, 2023

What it's about: Euphoria's Storm Reid stars in this thriller about a teen girl desperately trying to find her missing mother who disappeared overseas while on vacation with her new boyfriend.

If you loved the fast-paced, computer and phone screen-style format of the 2018 movie Searching, you'll love this standalone sequel.

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: January 26, 2023 on Paramount+

What it's about: This movie revival of the hit MTV series that ended in 2017 reunites most of Teen Wolf's original cast. A new evil emerging in Beacon Hills brings old friends and allies back together to fight a deadly enemy.

MORE: Everything We Know About Teen Wolf: The Movie

WATCH THE TRAILER HERE

When it premieres: March 10, 2023

What it's about: A 17-year-old attends the prestigious Mozart boarding school with aspirations of becoming a singer and quickly discovers a secret passageway to a mystical world of Mozart's "The Magic Flute."

Fans of fantasy stories will love this new movie starring Shadow and Bone's Jack Wolfe.

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: March 10, 2023

What it's about: A follow-up to the 2022 smash hit Scream (the fifth in the Ghost Face series), this sixth installment follows Tara (Jenna Ortega) and the other survivors who ditch the fictional town of Woodsboro, California to start a new life in New York City. However, they can't escape Ghost Face's clutches.

Scream 4's Hayden Panettiere returns to the franchise as Kirby. Unfortunately, the saga's beloved "final girl," Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell), will not be in this movie due to disagreements over salary.

Watch the trailer here

MORE: The Best New Horror Movies to Watch in 2023

When it premieres: March 30, 2023 on Disney Channel and March 31, 2023 on Disney+

What it's about: This teen rom-com follows BFFs Mandy (Peyton Elizabeth Lee) and Ben (Milo Manheim) who are surrounded by their classmates' over-the-top promposals. Mandy only has her eyes on getting into Harvard, but when she's waitlisted, she begrudgingly asks popular guy Graham (Blake Draper) — whose father has connections — for help.

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: April 28, 2023

What it's about: Based on the 1970 Judy Blume novel of the same name, this film adaptation follows Margaret (Abby Ryder Fortson) as she moves from the hustle and bustle of New York City to a more quiet suburban life in New Jersey. This coming-of-age movie will tug at your heartstrings.

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: May 12, 2023 on Disney+

What it's about: A kid and his best friends go on an adventure to explore a legendary crater before he is forced to relocate to another planet. The movie stars A Friend of the Family star Mckenna Grace.

Producer Shawn Levy said on Instagram that Crater began from an idea: "Stand By Me on the moon." (FYI, Stand By Me is an epic '80s movie you need to watch ASAP if you haven't already.)

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: May 12, 2023

What it's about: Based on the manga, Saint Seiya by Masami Kurumada, this action-adventure film follows the exploits of a goddess of war who is reincarnated in the body of a young girl. Orphan Seiya (Mackenyu) learns it's his destiny to protect the girl and save the world, NBD. However, to do so he'll have to face his past, which is never easy. The movie also stars On My Block's Diego Tinoco.

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: May 26, 2023

What it's about: This long-awaited live-action version of the 1989 Walt Disney animated classic follows a mermaid named Ariel (Halle Bailey) who strikes up a deal with Ursula the sea witch (Melissa McCarthy) to trade her beautiful voice for legs so she can explore life above sea level.

MORE: Everything We Know About Disney's The Little Mermaid Live-Action Film

You can currently stream the animated Little Mermaid on Disney Plus.

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: June 2, 2023

What it's about: This sequel to 2018's Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse continues the adventures of Miles Morales (voiced by Shameik Moore) as the web-slinging superhero.

Miles will be transported across the Multiverse, teaming up with Gwen Stacy (Hailee Steinfeld) and more Spider-People to take on a new villain.

You can currently stream Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse on Prime Video.

Watch the first look teaser here

When it premieres: June 23, 2023 on Disney+

What it's about: A hip-hop musical comedy, World's Best follows 12-year-old mathematics genius Prem Patel who learns his late dad was a famous rapper. So, Prem decides to honor his father memory and become a rapper, too. Of course, the journey to superstardom is never an easy one.

According to a press release, Utkarsh Ambudkar, who plays Prem's deceased father, said of the movie, "We are all really excited to be bringing this film to Disney+. It’s got dope music and great comedy, and it brings up some important themes in a really accessible way. It’s emotional, it’s full of love and amazing energy and is a film the entire family can watch together. Plus, it presents for the first time a South Asian family at the core of a Disney movie — something I never had growing up — and was something I really wanted to give young people today."

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: June 30, 2023

What it's about: Our favorite archaeologist is at it again with a new adventure in the fifth installment of this franchise. Details about the plot are under wraps for now.

You can currently stream the first four Indiana Jones movies on Paramount+.

Watch the trailer here

When it premieres: June 30, 2023

What it's about: Get ready to "release the Kraken" in this new animated movie from DreamWorks. Lana Condor voices the title character, a shy teen who really wants to fit in with her peers. However, that soon proves to be futile when she learns she is a descendant of the warrior Kraken queens and is in line to inherit the throne.

Liza Koshy, Euphoria's Colman Domingo, Nicole Byer, and more make up this stellar cast.

Watch the trailer here
